title: EU extends Operation Sophia for 6 months, still without ships
text:
The EU has renewed the mandate of Operation Sophia | Federico Scoppa/AFP via Getty Images EU extends Operation Sophia for 6 months, still without ships Mediterranean rescue mission could see return of naval vessels in coming months.

The EU has renewed the mandate of Operation Sophia, its effort to combat people-smuggling in the Mediterranean, for another six months — but will still not deploy ships, diplomats said.

The operation, headquartered in Rome, was launched as a naval mission in June 2015 at the peak of Europe's migration crisis. But under a compromise agreed in March this year, under pressure from Italy's then-Interior Minister Matteo Salvini of the far-right League, the operation was extended on the condition that it use only air assets.

That decision was heavily criticized by non-governmental organizations, who said it would put the rescue of refugees at risk, and even by the EU's foreign policy chief Federica Mogherini. Her spokeswoman declared that "Sophia is a maritime operation and it's clear that without naval assets, the operation will not be able to effectively implement its mandate."

Salvini, however, argued that the mission's rescue operations encouraged migrants and people-smugglers to undertake perilous trips across the Mediterranean with the aim of seeking asylum in Europe.

Four diplomats told POLITICO the decision to extend the mandate on its current terms was taken on Thursday by the EU's Political and Security Committee (PSC), which is composed of member countries' ambassadors and deals with defense and foreign policy issues.

Despite the six-month extension, one diplomat said the PSC could "revert to the matter much earlier if needed” — a hint that naval assets might return to the mission sooner.

Two of the diplomats said that the latest extension is meant to buy time as a deal among EU countries on taking in migrants rescued in the Mediterranean could be struck in the coming months. Such an agreement could open the way for the return of naval ships to Operation Sophia.

Salvini and his party are no longer in power, having last month brought down their governing coalition with the anti-establishment 5Star Movement. The new administration of the 5Stars and the center-left Democratic party has made clear it wants to be part of the EU's political mainstream.
description: Mediterranean rescue mission could see return of naval vessels in coming months.
